references.paper_title: U-net: Convolutional networks for biomedical image segmentation
references.reason: This paper introduces the U-Net architecture, a key model used in medical image segmentation that is highly relevant to the current paper's methodology.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This foundational paper in vision-language pre-training (VLP) provides the basis for many of the techniques used in the current paper's medical VLP framework.

references.paper_title: Contrastive learning of medical visual representations from paired images and text
references.reason: This is a pioneering work in medical VLP which directly inspires the current paper's approach to aligning images with radiology reports.

references.paper_title: GLORIA: A multimodal global-local representation learning framework for label-efficient medical image recognition
references.reason: This paper proposes a method for global-local alignment in medical VLP, which is highly relevant to the global-to-dense strategy presented in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Multi-granularity cross-modal alignment for generalized medical visual representation learning
references.reason: This paper focuses on improving the alignment between image and text tokens at different granularities, directly addressing a challenge faced in the current paper's approach.
